SEARCH
Module io.jstach.rainbowgum
Package io.jstach.rainbowgum

Interface LogProperties

All Known Subinterfaces:
LogProperties.MutableLogProperties
All Known Implementing Classes:
LogProperties.StandardProperties
public interface LogProperties
Provides String based properties like System.getProperty(String) for default configuration of logging levels and output. Since Rainbow Gum is configuration agnostic LogProperties is a simple string key and string value interface to allow almost any configuration implementation. The only required method to implement is valueOrNull(String) and thus LogProperties is a functional like interface but using builder() is preferred so that a description can be added.

If a custom LogProperties is not configured the default RainbowGum uses System properties.

The built-in properties to configure RainbowGum are modeled after Spring Boot logging

LogProperties should generally be accessed with the LogProperty.PropertyGetter and LogProperty.Property like-monads which will allow safe programmatic data conversion of the flat key values and useful error messages to users if the property cannot be mapped or is missing. For more declarative injection of properties see LogConfigurable which will generate builders that can use LogProperties.

Rainbow Gum treats "." in the keys as special separator analogous to JavaScript/JSON and various other configuration systems. Furthermore to work with a wide set of configuration systems once a property key has a value it is RECOMMENDED that there should not be other property key value with a key that is a prefix of the previously mentioned key. For example allowing two properties logging.example=stuff, logging.example.a=A is not recommended as logging.example is defined as a leaf. The exception to this rule is logging levels mapped to logger names for consistency with Spring Boot.

Rainbow Gum out of the the box supports parsing two formats into properties: Properties text, and URI.getRawQuery() percent encoded query parameters. The two different formats have different behavior for listOrNull(String) and mapOrNull(String). If a custom format of LogProperties is created those two methods may need to be extended.

A convention used through out Rainbow Gum is to have the property names as constants as it makes documentation easier. These constants name are suffixed with _PROPERTY or _PREFIX the former being a fully qualified key that maybe parameterized and the latter being a partial key ending with ".". The fully qualified keys are like leaves on a tree.

Property keys can be parameterized by using interpolateKey(String, Map) and a general pattern is logging.component.{name}.prop where "name" is a parameter. Many property constants use this to allow multiple configuration of components by name.

Built-in Property Patterns
Property Pattern Description
"logging.level" + "." + logger = LEVEL Sets the level for the logger. If logger name is missing then it is considered the root logger. System.Logger.Level.INFO is the default level for the root logger.
"logging.change" + "." + logger = boolean | List<LogConfig.ChangePublisher.ChangeType> Allows runtime changing of levels for the logger. By design RainbowGum does not allow loggers to change levels once initialized. This configuration will allow the level to be changed for the logger and its children and by default is false as the built-in LogProperties is generally static (system properties).
"logging.routes" = List<String> A comma separated list of routes that should be enabled. If not set "default" is the default.
"logging.route.{name}.appenders" = List<String> A comma separated list of appenders associated with the route. If not set "logging.appenders" is used.
"logging.route.{name}.publisher" = URI Looks up a publisher by URI scheme using the LogPublisherRegistry. The publisher is then configured by properties with "logging.publisher.{name}.".
"logging.appenders" = List<String> A comma separated list of appenders that should be enabled. If not set "console" is the default.
"logging.appender.{name}.output" = URI Looks up an output by URI scheme using the LogOutputRegistry. The output is then configured by properties with "logging.output.{name}.".
"logging.appender.{name}.encoder" = URI Looks up an encoder by URI scheme using the LogEncoderRegistry. The encoder is then configured by properties with "logging.encoder.{name}.".
"logging.output.{name}." + propertyName Configures the named output. The name of the output usually comes from the appender.
"logging.encoder.{name}." + propertyName Configures the named encoder. The name of the encoder usually comes from the appender.
"logging.file.name" = URI A URI or file path to log to a file. This is for Spring Boot compatibility.
See Also:

    • GROUPS_PROPERTY

      static final String GROUPS_PROPERTY
      Enabled level groups. The value should be a list of group names used on GROUP_PROPERTY. This is to enable Spring Boot like Log Groups . Note that unlike Spring Boot groups are not enabled unless this property contains the group.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • GROUP_PROPERTY

      static final String GROUP_PROPERTY
      Group property with list of logger names. The level of the group is set with "logging.level" + .{name} = Level or on the router itself with "logging.route.{name}.level" + .{name} = Level. This is largely compatible with Spring Boot Log Groups .
      See Also:
      • LevelResolver.parseLevel(String)

  • Method Details

    • valueOrNull

      @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key)
      Analogous to System.getProperty(String).
      Parameters:
      key - property name.
      Returns:
      property value.

    • value

      default String value(String key, String fallback)
      Analogous to System.getProperty(String, String) with the exception that the fallback cannot be null and the return cannot be null.
      Parameters:
      key - property name.
      fallback - returned if the value is not found and may not be null.
      Returns:
      value found or fallback.

    • listOrNull

      default @Nullable List<String> listOrNull(String key)
      Gets a list or null if the key is missing and by default uses parseList(String). The default implementation will parse the string value as a list using parseList(String) but custom implementations may rely on their own parsing or the data type is built-in to the backing configuration system.
      Parameters:
      key - property name.
      Returns:
      list or null.
      API Note
      the reason empty list is not returned for missing key is that it creates ambiguity so null is returned when key is missing.

    • mapOrNull

      default @Nullable Map<String,String> mapOrNull(String key)
      Gets a map or null if the key is missing and by default uses parseMap(String). The default implementation will parse the string value as map using parseMap(String) but custom implementations may rely on their own parsing or the data type is built-in to the backing configuration system.
      Parameters:
      key - property name.
      Returns:
      map or null.
      API Note
      the reason empty map is not returned for missing key is that it creates ambiguity so null is returned when key is missing.

    • stringPropertyOrNull

      default @Nullable LogProperties.FoundProperty.StringProperty stringPropertyOrNull(String key)
      Find string property or null.
      Parameters:
      key - property name.
      Returns:
      found property or null

    • findOrNull

      default <T extends @Nullable Object> @Nullable T findOrNull(String root, String key, BiFunction<LogProperties,String,@Nullable T> func)
      Searches up a "." separated path using this properties to check for values. The first value not missing (not null) will be returned.
      Type Parameters:
      T - result type
      Parameters:
      root - prefix.
      key - partial key that will have prefix concated on each try of func.
      func - convert function where null return means to keep searching.
      Returns:
      closest value or null if no value can be found.
      See Also:
      • findUpPathOrNull(String, Function)

    • description

      default String description(String key)
      Describes a key and by default is usually just the key.
      Parameters:
      key - key.
      Returns:
      usually the key.

    • order

      default int order()
      When log properties are coalesced this method is used to resolve order. A higher number gives higher precedence.
      Returns:
      zero by default.

    • builder

      static LogProperties.Builder builder()
      LogProperties builder.
      Returns:
      builder.

    • findGlobalProperties

      static LogProperties findGlobalProperties()
      Finds global properties by checking the currently bound rainbow gum and if not set use system properties. This method should be used sparingly and is preferred that you get the properties through a config instance instead.
      Returns:
      currently bound properties or system properties.
      API Note
      the intention of this method is to be used for ServiceLoader singleton components and other systems that maybe bound prior to rainbow gum loading that need to determine if they should be enabled.

    • findGlobalProperties

      static LogProperties findGlobalProperties(Supplier<? extends LogProperties> fallback)
      Finds global properties by checking the currently bound rainbow gum and if not set use the supplier as the fallback. This method should be used sparingly and is preferred that you get the properties through a config instance instead.
      Parameters:
      fallback - supplier to use if no rainbow gum is bound.
      Returns:
      currently bound properties or fallback.
      API Note
      the intention of this method is to be used for ServiceLoader singleton components and other systems that maybe bound prior to rainbow gum loading that need to determine if they should be enabled.

      static LogProperties of(List<? extends LogProperties> logProperties, LogProperties fallback)
      Creates log properties from many log properties.
      Parameters:
      logProperties - list of properties.
      fallback - if the logProperties list is empty.
      Returns:
      log properties

    • of

      static LogProperties of(List<? extends LogProperties> logProperties)
      Creates log properties from many log properties.
      Parameters:
      logProperties - the list of properties.
      Returns:
      if the logProperties is empty LogProperties.StandardProperties.EMPTY will be used.

    • of

      static LogProperties of(URI uri, String prefix, LogProperties properties)
      Creates log properties from a URI query and provided properties. This is useful for URI based providers where the URI query is contributing properties for the plugin.
      Parameters:
      uri - query will be used to pull properties from using parseUriQuery(String, BiConsumer).
      prefix - part of the key that will stripped before accessing the URI properties.
      properties - usually this is the properties coming from LogConfig.
      Returns:
      combined properties where properties is tried first than the URI query parameters.

    • of

      static LogProperties of(URI uri, String prefix, LogProperties properties, @Nullable String uriKey)
      Creates log properties from a URI query and provided properties. This is useful for URI based providers where the URI query is contributing properties for the plugin.
      Parameters:
      uri - query will be used to pull properties from using parseUriQuery(String, BiConsumer).
      prefix - part of the key that will stripped before accessing the URI properties.
      properties - usually this is the properties coming from LogConfig.
      uriKey - where the URI came from.
      Returns:
      combined properties where properties is tried first than the URI query parameters.

    • parseUriQuery

      static void parseUriQuery(String query, BiConsumer<String,@Nullable String> consumer)
      Parse a URI query in application/x-www-form-urlencoded format useful for parsing properties values that have key values embedded in them. This parser unlike form encoding uses %20 for space as the data is coming from a URI.
      Parameters:
      query - raw query component of URI.
      consumer - accept will be called for each entry and if key (left hand) does not have a "=" following it the second parameter on the consumer accept will be passed null.

    • parseMap

      static Map<String,String> parseMap(String query)
      Parses a URI query formatted string to a Map.
      Parameters:
      query - raw query component of URI.
      Returns:
      decoded key values with last key winning over previous equal keys.
      See Also:
      • parseUriQuery(String, BiConsumer)

    • parseMultiMap

      static Map<String,List<String>> parseMultiMap(String query)
      Parses a URI query for a multiple value map. The list values of the map maybe empty if the query parameter does not have any values associated with it which would be the case if there is a parameter (key) with no "=" following it. For example the following would have three entries of a,b,c all with empty list: 
       
 a&b&c&
      Parameters:
      query - raw query component of URI.
      Returns:
      decoded key values with multiple keys grouped together in order found.
      See Also:
      • parseUriQuery(String, BiConsumer)

    • parseList

      static List<String> parseList(String query)
      Parses a list of strings from a string that is percent encoded for escaping (application/x-www-form-urlencoded) where the separator can be either "&" or ",".

      An example would be using ampersand: 

      
  "a&b%20B&c" -> ["a","b B","c"]
      and comma: 
      
  "a,b,c" -> ["a","b","c"]
      Parameters:
      query - the comma or ampersand delimited string that is in URI query format.
      Returns:
      list of strings

    • findUpPathOrNull

      static <T extends @Nullable Object> @Nullable T findUpPathOrNull(String key, Function<String,@Nullable T> resolveFunc)
      Searches a "." separated property path recursing up the path till a non null value (not missing) is found.

      For example assume we have a single property set like logging.level.com.stuff=DEBUG and we call this function with logging.level.com.stuff.a.b.

      1. logging.level.com.stuff.a.b will resolve to null
      2. logging.level.com.stuff.a will resolve to null
      3. logging.level.com.stuff will resolve to "DEBUG", stop and return "DEBUG".
      Type Parameters:
      T - type to return.
      Parameters:
      key - the initial path.
      resolveFunc - function that returns the value at path or null.
      Returns:
      value or null if no non null value can be found.

    • concatKey

      static String concatKey(String name)
      Concats a key using SEP to the root prefix.
      Parameters:
      name - key.
      Returns:
      concat key.

    • concatKey

      static String concatKey(String prefix, String name)
      Concats a keys using SEP as the separator.
      Parameters:
      prefix - start of key.
      name - second part of key.
      Returns:
      key.

    • interpolateKey

      static String interpolateKey(String key, Map<String,String> parameters)
      Replace "{name}" tokens in property names.
      Parameters:
      key - property name.
      parameters - tokens to replace with entry values.
      Returns:
      interpolated property key.
      See Also:
      • interpolateKey(String, Function)

    • interpolateKey

      static String interpolateKey(String key, Function<String,? extends @Nullable String> lookup) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Replaces property key parameters by using the lookup function. Property keys are often parameterized usually by some name. The parameters are surrounded by curly braces and replaced by the lookup function. An example of the format is a.{PARAM} which has a parameter named PARAM. If the lookup function has PARAM->b then the result will be a.b. If a value for a parameter is null (indicates not found) an exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      key - to be interpolated.
      lookup - function that may return null for a parameter.
      Returns:
      interpolated key with all parameters replaced.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the lookup function does not have a value for a parameter.

    • interpolateNamedKey

      static String interpolateNamedKey(String key, String name)
      Interpolates a named key which is a property key that has a "name".
      Parameters:
      key - with name parameters.
      name - replace name token.
      Returns:
      interpolated property key.

    • removeKeyPrefix

      static String removeKeyPrefix(String key, String prefix)
      Remove key prefix from the key. Prefix should end in "." but this method does not check that.
      Parameters:
      key - key whose prefix will be removed.
      prefix - property name prefix.
      Returns:
      prefix removed if the string is prefixed.

    • keyParameters

      static Set<String> keyParameters(String key)
      Extract key parameters with PARAMETER_PATTERN.
      Parameters:
      key - also known as property name.
      Returns:
      parameters in key.

    • validateKeyParameters

      static void validateKeyParameters(String key, Set<String> parameters)
      Validate key parameters.
      Parameters:
      key - key to be interpolated with parameters.
      parameters - names of parameters which must equal the set of the found parameters. while the order obviously does not matter the set cannot have more parameters than found in the key.
